preqs: MID1001,MID2004, MID2006, MID2102; either MID2000 or both MID1002 and MID1003

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3563} Do Must have passed 6 (I/W) units in {MID1001, MID1002, MID1003, MID2004, MID2005, MID2006, MID2102} Otherwise true
Must be enrolled in course version {3562, 3563, 3564, 3892}
Must be enrolled in course version {3562, 3563, 3564, 3892}
(Must have passed 4 (I/W) units in {MID1001, MID2004, MID2006, MID2102} and  (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {MID2000} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {MID1002, MID1003}))

description: Through introduction of the broader womens health context, the unit explores the primary and collaborative role of the midwife working with women experiencing common women's health problems and their responses to these experiences. Students will be introduced to the physical and psychological aspects associated with selected womens health problems. The issue of women's experience of 'what is happening to me' and 'woman's sense of self' will be explored. The focus will be on fostering a positive self-image for women through facilitating participation in informed decision-making and taking responsibility for self-care and optimising wellness.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
